page.title: 17Roads.
page.content: A623 at Calver carries much heavy traffic on a carriageway about 7.5 m in width. At the crossroads there are traffic lights. Many cars at weekends stop nearby to call at the Garden Centre and sweetshop. Congestion results. B6001 on Calver Hill is gradually subsiding on the eastern side and has been patched. From the summit to Hassop, the road is tree-lined. Carriageway width is about 6 m. The road is busiest on Monday, market day in Bakewell. An unclassified road links Hassop to Longstone. It is lightly trafficked except for large vehicles which deliver live chickens to a processing station at Longstone. The road is as little as 4.5 m wide in places and at Hassop is tightly enclosed by walls.
